title: Reflection ‚Äî LLM Use
text:
Reflection ‚Äî LLM Use (300‚Äì500 words)


Date: Oct 22, 2025 ¬∑ Model(s): ChatGPT


What worked better as I added pages. Expanding to a multi-page structure clarified what belongs on each page and reduced cognitive load on the reader. The navbar gave me a stable mental model‚ÄîHome for quick context, Resume for depth, Projects for evidence, Skills/Certs for proof, and Contact for calls-to-action. Using an LLM helped me brainstorm section labels, write first drafts fast, and surface alternative phrasings. The biggest win was idea-generation and rewording; it saved time and helped me keep a consistent tone across pages.


Ensuring authenticity and accuracy. I treated the LLM‚Äôs output as a starting point, never as the source of truth. I replaced general phrasing with my real data: titles, dates, responsibilities, and the exact tools I used. I verified every claim against my resume and coursework, removed anything that sounded generic or unearned, and added context from my own experience‚Äîespecially metrics and outcomes where I had them. I also included an Appendix that stores the prompts and the unedited LLM drafts to make the AI contribution transparent.


What I‚Äôd improve next. I will add richer evidence (links to PDFs, brief case write-ups), collect concrete metrics for my highlights, and refine accessibility (alt text, heading order, contrast). I also plan to experiment with another theme and add a simple site search. Overall, the multi-page site feels more professional and scannable; the LLM is most helpful for brainstorming and polishing, while accuracy and voice are my responsibility.

title: Michelle Marie Ricart Naranjo
text:
Michelle Marie Ricart Naranjo
MBA Candidate ¬∑ University Canada West (UCW) ¬∑ Vancouver, BC
I have a degree in people-oriented industrial psychology, with experience in Human Resources, mainly in the Compensation and Benefits department, recruitment, and onboarding processes. I am currently developing my culinary skills in Vancouver, British Columbia. I always prioritize customer service, clarity, and reliability in processes, helping transform decisions into positive impact for companies and their operations.

View Resume View Projects Appendix




Highlights

3+ years in HR at Shell Dominican Republic: employee service, internal/external client support, documentation, and monthly metrics.
Culinary practice in high-speed environments focused on organization, teamwork, and high-quality standards.



Bilingual

Spanish (Native)

English (Second Language)



Recent Focus

People leadership in multicultural contexts.
Clear documentation and quality-control dashboards for decision-making.
Ongoing personal brand and career development using Quarto.

title: Appendix ‚Äî LLM Site Map & Drafts

title: Appendix ‚Äî LLM Site Map & Drafts
text:
C. LLM-generated section drafts (verbatim)

Home/About (draft)

One-paragraph intro that frames strengths in HR and service-oriented teamwork; mention bilingual ability.

3 bullets of highlights: HR experience in Shell licensee; high-paced culinary teamwork; bilingual.

CTA buttons to Resume, Projects, Appendix.



Resume (draft)

Education list (MBA UCW in progress; ILAC; UNPHU).

Experience with concise bullets for HR roles and recent culinary experience.

Skills grouped by People & Culture, Tools, Professional.

Resume PDF download button.



Projects/Case Studies (draft)

3 tiles/cards: TriMetrix Career Pathways; ILDP Odyssey; Marketing & Analytics coursework.

Each: Overview, Role, Outcome; link to PDF/repo.



Skills & Certifications (draft)

Badges for core skills (Comp & Benefits, Employee Services, Excel, Time Management, etc.).

Certifications placeholder (FoodSafe, HR coursework).

Tools & Methods (Excel, Word, Outlook, Quarto/Markdown).



Contact (draft)

Location, mailto email, LinkedIn link, resume download.

Note on static-site forms.

title: Appendix ‚Äî LLM Site Map & Drafts
text:
D. What I kept vs.¬†changed

Kept: Page structure, concise bullet style, CTA buttons.

Modified: Replaced generic wording with my real timeline, roles, and tools; polished tone.

Removed: Unverified claims and filler text.

Added: Links to resume PDF and project artifacts; accessibility tweaks.

title: Appendix ‚Äî LLM Site Map & Drafts

title: Resume
text:
Professional Experience


Compensation & Benefits Analyst ‚Äî Shell Licensee (Santo Domingo, DR)
Dec 2021 ‚Äì Sep 2024 - Responded to employee inquiries on benefits, payroll, and policies, improving service satisfaction. - Coordinated documentation with the Ministry of Labour; improved timeliness of certifications. - Prepared letters, contracts, and official communications with accuracy and standards.


General Analyst ‚Äî Shell Licensee (Santo Domingo, DR)
Dec 2021 ‚Äì Aug 2024 - Supported recruitment, onboarding, and training logistics for positive new-hire experiences. - Delivered front-line support to employees and external partners. - Standardized communications and document control to ensure consistency.


Culinary & Hospitality ‚Äî Vancouver, Canada
2025 - Cook, Guilt and Co (Oct 2025 ‚Äì Present): ensure ingredient quality; organize station; execute menu items and prep to standard. - Line Cook, Six Acres (Mar 2025 ‚Äì May 2025): maintain quality control and cleanliness; complete assigned dishes and prep. - Plater, Fed (Mar 2025 ‚Äì Sep 2025): accurate plating, portions, and presentation in a high-volume environment.

Nov 2019 ‚Äì Nov 2021 - Inventory, order prep, and ERP updates to maintain availability.
